intro: Erigeron consimilis, commonly known as the plains fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as prairies and roadsides. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Erigeron consimilis is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
